channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Wellness trends worth taking into the new year (and some that aren't)
item.description: We reported on all sorts of products and practices promising to make you healthy last year. Here are the ones that stood up to science, and those that...

item.title: Here's a partial list of U.S. elected officials opposing Trump's invasion of Venezuela
item.description: Trump's decision to depose Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro has drawn praise inside the U.S., especially from Republican leaders. But the invasion ...

item.title: Trump wants U.S. oil companies in Venezuela. Here's what to know
item.description: President Trump wants more U.S. oil companies to "go in" to Venezuela. But there are economic, historical, and climate reasons that may not be easy. H...

item.title: A tale of two U.S. interventions and why Venezuela is not Panama 2.0
item.description: Operation Absolute Resolve, that resulted in the capture of Nicolás Maduro, echoes the 1990 U.S. invasion of Panama that brought down Manuel Noriega. ...

item.title: Venezuela is the latest in the U.S.'s long history of interventions in Latin America
item.description: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe talks to Eduardo Gamarra, professor of politics and international relations at Florida International University, about the history...

item.title: Officers who defended the Capitol on Jan. 6 say their struggles linger, 5 years after the riot

item.description: Nicolas Maduro and his wife are expected to face federal charges related to drug trafficking and working with gangs designated as terrorist organizati...

item.title: After capture and removal, Venezuela’s Maduro is being held at notorious Brooklyn jail
Who is Cilia Flores, Venezuela's once-powerful first lady?
item.description: Long seen as a powerful figure, Flores has also faced allegations of corruption and nepotism.

item.title: Inside the geopolitical impact of the U.S. raid to capture Maduro in Venezuela
item.description: The U.S. military operation to capture Nicolás Maduro and his wife, Cilia Flores, will likely have major ramifications on the world stage. CBS News na...

item.title: Trump says the U.S. will "run" Venezuela for now. What do we know about the plans?
item.description: The U.S. captured Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro and his wife in an overnight military operation, President Trump announced.

item.title: Can Maduro's trusted lieutenant now work for Trump?
item.description: Delcy Rodríguez, a close ally of captured Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro, has been named interim president.

item.title: All 40 Swiss bar fire victims identified as community grieves
item.description: The New Year's Eve fire at a bar in the Swiss Alpine resort of Crans-Montana left 40 dead and dozens severely injured.

item.title: Police identify all 40 victims of Swiss bar fire
item.description: Among those killed by the blaze at Le Constellation is 16-year-old Swiss national Arthur Brodard, his mother confirms.

item.title: Danish PM tells Trump to stop 'threats' against Greenland
item.description: Mette Frederiksen said the "US has no right to annex any of the three nations in the Danish kingdom".

item.title: Rubio says US won’t govern Venezuela but will press for changes through oil blockade
item.description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio is suggesting the United States won’t govern Venezuela other than enforcing an existing “oil quarantine” on the country...

item.title: Russia, China and Iran condemn U.S. action in Venezuela
item.description: Russia, China and Iran have all publicly condemned the U.S. action in Venezuela. CBS News producer Leigh Kiniry has the latest.
